item.title: Lowe's beats Wall Street expectations as it starts to break out of sales slump
item.description: Lowe's followed rival Home Depot in reporting better-than-expected quarterly sales.

item.title: Shares of world's largest brewer AB InBev pop 8% after posting fourth-quarter revenue beat even as volumes slide
item.description: The drinks maker, whose brands include Budweiser, Corona and Stella Artois, reported an 3.4% increase in fourth-quarter revenue to $14.84 billion.

item.title: Crisis-stricken Stellantis sees revenue growth in 2025 after 70% drop in full-year profit
item.description: Crisis-stricken auto giant Stellantis on Wednesday said it sees return to revenue growth this year after a steep drop in 2024 earnings.

item.title: Lucid CEO steps down; EV maker plans to more than double production in 2025
item.description: Lucid said Marc Winterhoff, currently the company's chief operating officer, has taken over as interim CEO.

item.title: Workday beats estimates for revenue and profit, stock jumps
item.description: Workday exceeded analysts' estimates for the quarter and pointed to stronger demand from artificial intelligence products.
